author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Is it too clumsy to have the category name be "eth-execution" rather than "ethX"? I was a fan of terseness until recently. Even though they're *just* channel names it seems wiser to have the terminology here align with what we'd want the community to see: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/598292067260825641/844761091220832256

author: butta
content: because the launchpad is called "Eth2 Launchpad" ðŸ˜…

author: m.kalinin
content: Eth2 is a version of Ethereum with PoS and Shards, right?

author: potuz
content: I have a vague suspicion that people want to avoid the term eth2 for possible tax reasons. To my mind the fear that people may think it's a different token is not that important. There are millions of ways people get conned anyway

author: experience_
content: I don't think this is at all the reason. It's more like, eth2 used to be part of a specific roadmap at some point in time but now that roadmap has significantly changed and the planned staged releases don't reflect anymore the original idea of the upgrade

author: potuz
content: Yeah but it's widely adopted to mean the token that is held on validators balances

author: experience_
content: Well, I would disagree with that, for me ETH2 referred to a protocol significant protocol upgrade, and there's no distinction between the tokens. The ETH held on validator balances is ETH.

author: potuz
content: It's fine to call it whatever people decide, I don't mind, but I myself don't see it too bad to be eth2

author: experience_
content: It's a communication issue, a number of people have the expectation that eth2 means lower gas fees, scalability, sharding, you name it, and that all of that will happen at the same time in a big release called "eth2" and at that point everyone will be happy

author: experience_
content: even if it was the case at some point, it isn't now, and people are seeking to clear that confusion
